Jul 5 2009 	Good Value Relative to Other Manhattan Hotels	My first reaction staying here was: "Wow, what a lot of tourists!" and was kind of worried that I'd be awake all night listening to people partying in their rooms, street noise, etc. But that wasn't the case. My room was on a high floor and well insulated against noise. You heard some stuff, but once you draw the curtains, the room is pretty dark and quiet allowing a good night's sleep.My second reaction is that the hotel is BIG. You walk into the lobby, look straight up and realize that there are something like 50 floors with what appear to be 100 rooms per floor. Probably not that much, nonetheless it's an impressive sight. There are glass elevators that go all the way up. Maybe a concern if you're acrophobic.Via the elite desk, check in was pretty fast. For guests without elite status, there was a line, but it seemed to be moving. At least, no one was grumbling ... not even a family with four kids.This hotel obviously gets a lot of traffic. The halls looked like they'd been redone in the past few years, but even so the rugs are getting dingy in high-traffic areas. I had a colleague with a room similar to mine and both showed wear (chipped counters, scratched furniture, etc.), though both were also very clean.Rooms were large relative to most New York hotels and included a king size bed (which was very comfortable), desk and work area, a couch, coffee table, separate chair with ottoman, large dresser, and still leave plenty of room to unpack and mill about. I ordered room service (where they brought in a trolley with the meal) with two colleagues and I working in the room; there was still room to move around, use the desk, sit on the couch, etc. I visit New York several times a year -- most hotel rooms are "cozy", to use a kind word, even at "luxury" hotels. Usually there's barely enough room to open your suitcase.Room service was ok but not great. I used it several times and it was hit or miss. The food quality was fine, but the service was at times a little off. They made mistakes on at least one order, though they corrected it quickly.Internet service, workspace amenities, business center, fitness center, etc. were all pretty good. The hotel has everything except a pool. There are several restaurants ... I ate at the View which has a nice view of Times Square and one of the lobby restaurants. Both were fine.The hotel's highlight other than size and space is its location. It's right in the middle of Times Square which depending on your point of view is either really good or really bad. Even with the change in traffic patterns (i.e., the city shut down parts of Broadway and made them pedestrian zones), it's still very crowded -- packed with tourists. But it is convenient for midtown business, transportation, etc. and at a decent price. I got a corporate rate that was about $275 before tax.Overall, a pretty good hotel for the price relative to what's available in NYC.

And being able to walk right out the front of the hotel and directly onto Times Square and all the nearby shops and restaurants is very convenient and not to mention quicker by not having to fight cab traffic. And if you do need to go somewhere, getting a cab is fairly easy. The hotel itself is nice, has a great restaurant and was pretty decent. Its definately not new, but my room was clean which is most important. The rooms were average Marriott rooms with bed and a nice chair and have everything you need. Besides with so much to do in the area, who wants to stay in the room? The elevator banks are interesting and how they assign you one that goes directly to your floor, rather than getting in and punching numbers is kind of cool. And the lobby is not on the ground floor, but once you figure all of that out, it's easy to get around.

Jul 2 2009 	Another great stay at the Marquis	Plain and simply the best hotel in Time Square. Best lobby bar in time square with the best TS views, roof top rotating restaurant bar, 40 story lobby atrium.....It is located right in the heart of time square. At check in I was given an upgrade to a suite which was an amazing blessing considering we were traveling with 2 toddlers. Everyone was professional and helpful. No more to be said. If your going to NY and want to be in the middle of it all, stay at the Marquis!

Jun 30 2009 	We had a great experience at Marriott Marquis NYC	Great Location, nice large room, King bed. My son thought the elevators were like an amusement park ride. The staff was helpful and attentive. I would stay here again when traveling with my son
